help.title: Column Name
help.short: The name used to refer to the column.

full.p: Every column must have a name, and you cannot have duplicate column names within a single table.
Column names must start with a letter, optionally followed by a succession of numbers, letters and spaces. You cannot have adjacent spaces, nor spaces at the beginning or end.

help.title: Column Type
help.short: The type (e.g. number, text, date) of the values in the column.

full.p: All the values in a column must have the same type, such as number, text or date.
Having all the values be of the same type avoids many errors in transformations, such as trying to multiple two text items together.
If you need a column to have multiple types, use a tagged type.

help.title: Default Value
help.short: The default value in the column when a new row is added.

full.p: Values in columns cannot be absent, so a default value is required for when a new row is added.
If you want to have a "blank" value for a column, use a tagged type with a Blank tag.

help.title: Column Expression
help.short: This specifies the calculation of the column.

full.p: This is like a formula in a spreadsheet or mathematics.

help.title: Table Name
help.short: The name of the table being created.

full.p: Every table must have a name, and tables may not share the same name.
Table names must start with a letter, optionally followed by a succession of numbers, letters and spaces. You cannot have adjacent spaces, nor spaces at the beginning or end.
